author: Dan
text: I really trusted the firm with their authentication process.  Received the glasses, they were damaged as well as looked cheap for being Gucci glasses. The emblems were plastic and the lens was not stamped. It gave me the hunch they were not real.  I drove 45min to have them authenticated based on a hunch.  Thank goodness I did!  The Gucci store found them to be bad copy counterfeits.  I immediately emailed them let them know I received fake counterfeits.  I packaged them to be sent back!  I received an email on a Saturday which Was great!  That’s about the only good thing that came out this transaction.  They waived the fees associated with a return.  They apologized but the damage is done.  I do not trust them now.  A quick search on the internet would have shown me to not trust them.  There are plenty of articles stating they are known for having counterfeit items. I usually shop on another online app but thought I’d try this one.  Lesson learned.  I’m so crushed as I loved the glasses but I refuse to pay over $150 for a pair of counterfeit eye ware.  I hope they figure out what is going on in their company whether it be more training or penalizing employees who authenticate fake items but something needs to be done.  Their reputation is definitely affected.  They lost a client in me.  Based on the waiving of the fees and Saturday customer service I give them a star otherwise they would one.
title: Trusted them and was let down

author: Maraya
text:
Yet again received a defective item. Between shipping and return shipping (both at customer expense with this company), their mistake will cost me $24, not to mention disappointment and inconvenience.
This Prada dress has lost all elasticity in the waist, yet they totally clamped it in to cover that up, and categorized it as in “excellent” shape. They will not take responsibility for their misrepresentation.
Even worse, I know from experience that after I return it, they will stick it right back up on their site with the same description and photos, for the next unsuspecting customer to go through the same thing.
Until it becomes an unreturnable item and someone gets stuck with it.
title: No responsibility for a defective item, SCAM
